This chunk is part of the `EntryScale` class implementation within a larger document that defines custom Tkinter-based widgets for color manipulation panels. The code creates a maximum value label widget (`maxLabel`) that displays the current maximum value, binds a right-click event to it for user interaction, and initializes component options. This specific section handles the display and configuration of the maximum value indicator in the graphical interface.

Context:  
The chunk is part of the `EntryScale` class initialization within the document, responsible for creating and configuring a maximum value label that can be interactively adjusted via right-click.

self.maxLabel = self.createcomponent('maxLabel', (), None,
                                             tk.Label, self.minMaxFrame,
                                             text = repr(self['max']),
                                             relief = tk.FLAT,
                                             width = 5,
                                             anchor = tk.E,
                                             font = "Arial 8")
        self.maxLabel.bind('<Button-3>', self.askForMax)
        self.maxLabel.pack(side='left', fill = 'x')
        self.minMaxFrame.pack(expand = 1, fill = 'both')

        # Check keywords and initialise options based on input values.
        self.initialiseoptions(EntryScale)
